website_summaries.verdict: This model retains the ergonomic features of the 4000 business model, without some of the features designed specifically for the workplace.
pros: Ergonomic slope from center of QWERTY keyboard
Reduced strain on wrists and hands during typing
Reduce risk of carpal or other typing-related injuries
Keyboard includes one-touch media keys for easy control of audio and video files
Split keyboard design prevents unnatural reach while typing
Encourages a professional and efficient typing style
The wired connection ensures reliable, uninterrupted connection to all desktop computers or similar computing devices
cons: The keys on this model seem to click a little louder during typing than on some keyboards
Padded wrist rest wears over time

customer_reviews.title: Probably better for home use...
customer_reviews.text: I work at a software company, and spend 9-10 hours per day pounding away on this thing. Pros: 1. I'm able to type extremely quickly on this, and it's very comfortable. 2. No wrist fatigue 3. Little to no readjustment period from traditional keyboard angles to the more ergonomic style here Cons: 1. Key strikes are very loud. They can hear me typing two offices away. 2. The letters have completely rubbed off of all letters aside from Q, W, Z and X. Good thing I'm not a "hunt and peck" typist 3. F lock is intermittent - you only realize it's off when you try to use it and get some other function popping up instead
customer_reviews.author: H. Wolf

customer_reviews.title: Not good for carpal-tunner RSI folks AT ALL.
customer_reviews.text: The best ergonomic keyboard and mouse on the market, hands-down, is the wireless Logitech Wave keyboard/mouse pack. However, my workplace recently banned all wireless keyboards so I went in search of a wired replacement. This is NOT it. The space bar is HARD to push, sticky, and this hurts my hands. I'll be tossing it in the trash soon. I bought the Fellowes Microban Split Design Wired Keyboard, much better, similar to the Logitech Wave. LOGITECH - PLEASE RELEASE A WIRED VERSION OF YOUR WAVE KEYBOARD! The Logitech M500 is a good ergo mouse, wired. Signed, 30-year software engineer.
customer_reviews.author: High-Tech Mom

customer_reviews.title: So far After 15 min check: The PROs=1, the NEGATIVES=4
customer_reviews.text: PRO=It's lot more comfortable typing on this than the old-style keyboards; NEGATIVES= 1) KEYs and SPACEBAR LOUD, distracting; 2) As others said, the ZOOM function does NOT work at all; 3) NO MANUAL OR FUNCTION INSTALLATION CD included, so have NO IDEA what the numbered buttons above the F buttons do Note: I found the manual online and even THAT does NOT say anything about those buttons); 4=The spacing ON EACH SIDE of some of the keys are slightly different (i.d., from F to B below it awkward to hit, keep hitting G). The 5th problem is only for watch or Fitbit users: Your watch hits right on the rest area making it uncomfortable unless you change watchband position.
customer_reviews.author: Movie lover from HB

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and quality
customer_reviews.text: I love this keyboard. So comfortable to type in. This is my 2nd one. My first one I took to work to use there since I Type all day long. I used to be a data processor and I learned the value of ergonomic early. No pain and no sign of carpel tunnel especially considering the amount of typing I do per day. This keyboard for me is a lifesaver and it is dang good looking. I used to have a white ergonomic keyboard from Microsoft and this is even better than before. Not my favorite gaming keyboard but I have zero problems gaming on this. (Only because it doesn’t have rgb lights and gamers should rgb-right?)
customer_reviews.author: Chatty

customer_reviews.title: Ergonomic and big
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this keyboard for a few months now. I use it daily at work, and I type a lot. The letters have started to rub off, but that’s not a big deal. I have a hard time with how BIG the keyboard is though. I feel like I am constantly stretching my fingers to do coding.. like use enter/shift/any of the F buttons up top. Anything outside of just the letters on the keyboard are a bit not-ergonomic. I really like the keyboard overall though. It is sturdy and the break in the keyboard does help my wrists from getting sore. Overall, I would still recommend this keyboard for the price point. 👍🏻
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Nagle

customer_reviews.title: Microsoft not standing behind warranty.
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for about a year. Now the number pad doesn't work. Even though the Num Lock is on, the number pad is intermittent. I will be keying in numbers and all of a sudden it will stop working. Contacted Microsoft within warranty period and they said this hardware issues is not covered under the warranty of the product. Do not understand that at all and am very frustrated. I will be ordering a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: EF

customer_reviews.title: Excellent keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Even though I use it for Mac, which renders a lot of the additional buttons useless (only the volume and play/pause buttons work), I consider this a great ergonomic keyboard. Takes a couple of days to get used to, specially the space bar, but after that it’s very comfortable and nice to use. The only complaint I have is that the letters have been erased on a few keys after several months of daily use (attached a photo), but it’s for the keys I don’t even look at while typing so it doesn’t bother me that much. Also, the wrist rest area has been very durable, though I do try to keep it clean.
customer_reviews.author: Oscar

customer_reviews.title: I like the ergonomic slant, but...
customer_reviews.text: Ok. This isn't my first ergonomic keyboard, but not the best one I have had. The keys are really stiff, especially the spacebar. clunk clunk clunk, I am wore out typing on this. And the worse thing is, never never cause a key to jump off the keyboard, because they are devilishly hard to get back on. I mean don't even think about removing a key for any reason. They have springs and wires and complicated things going on, where older keyboards you can pop off and back on, no trouble. I have no idea what half of the stuff does on this, because I DIDN'T GET A MANUAL of any kind. I recommend shopping for something else.
customer_reviews.author: Paula Fye

customer_reviews.title: Most bestest keyboard in the world
customer_reviews.text: I started having carpal tunnel symptoms when the original Microsoft Natural came out. I bought one, and avoided wrist surgery. The latest incarnation in the form of the Natural 4000 is the most usable keyboard they've produced since the very first original. It doesn't last that long, but it's a great keyboard. I buy a new one every 18 months or so, and will continue doing so as long as they continue selling these things.
customer_reviews.author: D. Michael McIntyre

customer_reviews.title: Good ergonomic keyboard that works for Mac or PC
customer_reviews.text: I've used several of these keyboards on my work PC over the years, and they're pretty good. When my old trackball started double-clicking for every click, I decided to replace both it and my keyboard. I was a little concerned that a Microsoft-branded keyboard wouldn't work as well with my home setup (MacBook Pro and USB hub), but it does... you just have to remember that the Windows key is the Command key (⌘), also historically known as the open-Apple key. My Mac did ask me to push a few keys at first startup, so that it could properly identify the keyboard, but that seems to have done the trick. The Volume keys even function properly!
customer_reviews.author: N. Stephan

customer_reviews.title: Buy something else.  Cheap.
customer_reviews.text: It's... ok. I mean, it does help my wrists but none of the hotkeys/toggles work and after only 3 months of moderate use the letters are wearing away. I no longer have an 'E', 'L' or '.' I would have returned once I realized the hotkey / toggles weren't working but it was beyond the return policy at that point. I didn't really start using this until after a couple months of purchase so that's my fault. So, I'd suggest buying something else as it's really disappointing and only half works.
customer_reviews.author: Nenosorac

customer_reviews.title: Best Ergonomic Keyboard on the market
customer_reviews.text: Despite its strange appearance, these are the best ergonomic keyboards on the market over the long-term. It's true that it takes a few weeks to get used to the split keyboard design, but once you do it's like resting your hands on a cloud. Using the included stand (which tilts the keyboard downward, away from you), it's much more natural resting position for your hands - if you hold your hands out flat, palms down, in front of you then let them drop, the position they fall into is very similar to where they are when using this keyboard. For people at risk of repetitive stress disorders, this one is a godsend.
customer_reviews.author: TYLER H PERKINS

customer_reviews.title: Been a LONG TIME fan of this keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this make/model of keyboard for years. It looks like MS might no longer be making it? Had to purchase my newest one from a 3rd party seller and was $70. I remember purchasing it for as little as $30 a few years back. Sadly I don't see anything new on the market with the same design and fit & finish. I didn't realize how badly I'd worn the old one one (been at least 2 years of CONSTANT use) until I plugged this new one in and was like "ahhhh, typing on silk!". Might need to stock up if they're no longer being made!
customer_reviews.author: W. Westlake

customer_reviews.title: Decent design. Loud keys, 2 buttons don't work after 2 months of use.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product for work, where I do a lot of typing every day. PROS: The design is decent for those who can't afford the super expensive ergonomic keyboards. CONS: Typing noise. If you're looking for modern keyboard with minimal typing noise, skip this keyboard. Also, after not even 2 months of daily use, my F5 key and period key on the number pad don't work. If they were keys that I didn't use often, that would be one thing, but those two keys are crucial and it's quite annoying to not have the ability to refresh from the keyboard. I am also just outside of the return window so I'm not able to return or exchange it.
customer_reviews.author: Jud

customer_reviews.title: AVOID. Believe all the reviews about the hard to press space bar.
customer_reviews.text: I ignored the reviews that talked about the hard to press the spacebar. I thought that it was just a small percentage of people perhaps being overcritical. WRONG! After a 6 month break-in period mine still requires more than normal force to depress and is unnatural to do. I'm trashing this otherwise lovely keyboard because of this. This product has a 3 year warranty. I tried to make a claim through Microsoft. After 90 minutes, 3 phone calls and 2 disconnects I gave up. Their warranty claim procedures are onerous, complicated and seemed designed to dissuade you from getting a satisfactory result. My trust in purchasing a product from a trusted big brand has been shattered.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph Stevens

customer_reviews.title: The case of the disappearing letters...
customer_reviews.text: I really like this keyboard due to its comfort. However, I am very disappointed that the key paint disappears too quickly. I've got no "A", "S", "D", or "C" and only a partial "E", "R", and "V". The keys still work. The letters have gone incognito. Even after buying a new keyboard (I bought the same one again as I like the comfort and feel) the letters started disappearing within a couple of months. I'd sure like to see some proactive action on behalf of Microsoft to reach out and replace the keys with new ones that are painted to last a few years as opposed to a few weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Topher

customer_reviews.title: Stops working in less than 1 year.
customer_reviews.text: I realy like the ergonomic shape and fit of this keyboard. I got this for work and first a few keys and the more stopped working. It didn’t last very long. I used like this very much and have had a total of four of many years. The first two I got and used years ago and they worked great with no issues for many years. The two more recent ones (one through work purchase a year ago and the other replacement one this year from Amazon) both had certain keys stop working in less than a year! The quality has deteriorated and I won’t risk buying another of this brand again. Buyer beware
customer_reviews.author: John S.

customer_reviews.title: Pretty decent keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I am writing this review after having this keyboard for 5 years. It's now time to replace it but I think 5 years of daily use was not too bad. The reason I'm replacing it is the wrist rest is coming apart and peeling. Other than that, it was a very solid keyboard. The letters on the keys have faded some. You can barely see the S anymore. I like that you can customise the buttons at the top and I use the calculator button a bunch. Overall would buy again but I tried a different MS ergo keyboard this time.
customer_reviews.author: Schim

customer_reviews.title: A wonderful keyboard!
customer_reviews.text: I am a transcriptionist, I have been transcribing corporate/independent video production companies programs for clients for over 20 years. I have always used an ergonomic keyboard, to try and avoid Carpal Tunnel Syndrome. This keyboard works great, love it. Good feel. Responsive. And my keyboard gets used a lot! My only complaints are that the characters on the keys wear off rather quickly. A disappointment. And I can't get more than two years of service out of it before it starts giving me problems.
customer_reviews.author: Kim Meseck

customer_reviews.title: Love Hate Relationship
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using this kind of keyboard for my whole professional career, which is about 6 years by now. The ergonomics are great. The keyboard is cheap. Great value there. Complaints: I’m on my third. I had a key give out on one (mostly fixed by shoving a paper wad under the key to aid with pushing the rubber membrane) and the lettering rubs off after a couple years. The Mac support is not great, with just the media control working by default. I downloaded a custom profile for ControllerMate that fixes the extra shortcuts.
customer_reviews.author: Jamison

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT ALL-ROUND ERGONOMIC KEYBOARD AT A GOOD PRICE
customer_reviews.text: I use this keyboard for typing and for navigating the internet. The keys have a positive, definite response and it is very quiet to type on. All documentation is found online. There are four configurations depending on what feels best for your hands and wrists: You can use the keyboard sloping downward and away from you; sloping upward toward you, or level from front to rear with two different heights (flush with the surface it rests on or raised 2" above it). It also has features and options which I will never use .
customer_reviews.author: M. Arthur

customer_reviews.title: Key labels hard to see.
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard is nice, I like the 'natural' style and have been using a similar keyboard for years. Switching from a 20+ year old PS/2 Microsoft Natural keyboard to this one was no problem at all. My only real issue is the lettering on the keys. It is small, and grey on black. Very hard for my old eyes to see. I had to buy a set of vinyl stick-on keyboard labels so I could actually see the keys. After a bout a week of use, I have not used the special buttons at all. I have no doubt they work just fine.
customer_reviews.author: James Pelt

customer_reviews.title: Space bar sticks - BAD!!!
customer_reviews.text: Because of the design of the space bar key, it sticks. The way it is designed on this keyboard is that unless you hit the middle of the 5-1/2" wide space bar, it will stick. And this happens on either the left side, or the right side. And mine sticks enough to make this keyboard nearly unusable. I like the tactile feel of the other keys, maybe even better than the 7000. I like the Num Lock, Caps Lock, Scroll Lock & Function Key LEDS. I do not like how bad the space bar sticks. I think I may be forced to return this one and try my luck with another seller.
customer_reviews.author: Janet Olson

customer_reviews.title: This is my third one.
customer_reviews.text: It is my third one, so I must like it. Note: the new one requires more stroke pressure on the keys than the last two did. I don't remember a break in period before, I'm hoping that the keys get easier - softer to depress as it wears. Any one interested in long term use, the black rubbery palm pad wears and comes off after a year or two. Both of my other two have the "C" key worn to where you cannot see anything printed on it. The input speed seems slower than before, but then my computer and I are both getting old. Happy typing.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen C. Zoeller

customer_reviews.title: Still the best wired split keyboard out there
customer_reviews.text: I type hours a day at three computer stations, so a split keyboard is a must for me. These wired keyboards have lasted me for over a decade. I tried two Microsoft wireless (better size without the needless number keypad) but they both broke within a year and I went back to this wired model. If you're a serious typist, these also have a fairly long keystroke which keeps your fingers from getting lazy like the short keystroke models do. The long keystroke forces me to keep my fundamental finger movements accurate, which cuts down errors in the long run. This keyboard is the BEST! [I only wish they'd make a wired Sculpt model]
customer_reviews.author: John P.

customer_reviews.title: Letters difficult to see on letter keys, impossible to see on special keys
customer_reviews.text: This is the "business" model of this keyboard, not the retail version. The letters on the keys are centered and painted light gray instead of white (that would be easier to see). The special keys that are silver are also painted light grey, making them impossible to see. There is no text next to the special keys to help identify them. Unless you are a good touch typist, this is not the keyboard for you. The angle of the keyboard is very configurable. Keys are quiet.
customer_reviews.author: Rooster

customer_reviews.title: Nice but one drawback
customer_reviews.text: I like the feel of this, and it cuts down on wrist strain quite a bit. Takes some getting used to though. My main disappointment is that it doesn't register until Windows is booted up, so if you need to to go into the CMOS settings before boot up, you are out of luck. Rarely, the computer won't even start and says "no keyboard detected." I ended up returning it. Maybe I have a weird computer, but other USB keyboards work just fine.
customer_reviews.author: John2123

customer_reviews.title: Letters Rub Off the Keys Very Quickly
customer_reviews.text: I love the feel of this keyboard so I have owned two. The first one the letters rubbed off the keys and I went years without them. I cannot actually type but have been pecking for so long I sort of know where the keys are. I finally got sick of not having letters and ordered another thinking surely the new ones will last longer and also forgetting how quickly they had rubbed off the first time. Sure enough, once again the keys wore off. This time I noticed that it was in a month or so after use. I will give the Logitech a try when I order my next one.
customer_reviews.author: John Tyce

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE it. Thing to know is Microsoft does not ...
customer_reviews.text: When my OLD Microsoft Ergonomic keyboard was ready to retire I clearly wanted to replace with another one. This model has many more features than the previous one...not sure I'll need them all...however I'm prepared for when I do. I LOVE it. Thing to know is Microsoft does not provide a manual letting you know what everything does. And after MANY hours searching and searching, ready through posts etc. (seems many people are on the same treasure hunt) I found what I needed on YouTube. A person there provided a great tutorial. Just type in the full name and you'll find what you need. My wrists and hands are happy and typing is a breeze.
customer_reviews.author: Celebrating Life

customer_reviews.title: Pick another N Sticks Quality is not the same as it used to be.
customer_reviews.text: This is the third Microsoft Ergonomic Keyboard I have had. Loved the first two. This one has an issue. The "N" key sticks onto the space bar and is hard to press and often times puts a space with the "N" when typing. I like the keyboard other than that. I will try to take it apart and see what is causing the key to bind to the space bar but for people that don't want to do anything like that you may want to move to a different keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: J. Koller

customer_reviews.title: The best ergonomic keyboard you can get for the money
customer_reviews.text: I've worn out about three of these over the last 12 years and the quality is wonderful. It works awesome for ergonomics and the plug-and-play capacity is great. I've always had good things to say about this Microsoft ergonomic keyboard and I think anybody that wants a good ergonomic keyboard at a fair price that's going to last them should buy this. after about two years I wear all of the paint off of the keys is the only complaint that I have is that the numbers and letters on the core keys that I use a lot do end up getting rubbed off and worn off
customer_reviews.author: Pamela R

customer_reviews.title: Great Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this type of keyboard for many years. I simply overused my old and had to purchase a new one. This is the PERFECT ergo keyboard. I had an ergonomic evaluation at work & this one was recommended. Now that we are 100% remote since March 2020, I purchased the same one for my home office and it still works EQUALLY as effective here at home. Your hands are positioned correctly as you type and your wrists lay at the proper angle WITHOUT cramping and risk of injury. I highly recommend this keyboard. Also, it arrived AHEAD of schedule which is ALWAYS a bonus!
customer_reviews.author: LJ_MyDestiny

customer_reviews.title: the space bar is very stiff, and...
customer_reviews.text: Someone said the space bar is hard to push, and they were not kidding. The keys feel alright to me, but they are not real sensitive like my first Microsoft Ergo Keyboard years ago. I don't know why they would change such a good thing. Sigh... I failed on another brand and likely will keep this just because I don't want to keep going round on it, or pay $100. Drat.
customer_reviews.author: Helen Myrick

customer_reviews.title: Letters on keys wear off quickly
customer_reviews.text: Love the comfort of this keyboard BUT within 2-3 weeks, the letters on the keys wear off. Really annoying that they can't figure out a way to permanently ETCH the letters in there and thankfully, I'm a touch typist but when you buy a product and pay $50 for it, you'd expect to get more than 2-3 weeks out of it for full functionality. Not sure what the solution is ... Amazon and Microsoft aren't all that helpful other than "return for refund" which would leave me out a keyboard for a week, then another 2 week of use, rinse, repeat. :(
customer_reviews.author: nebraskama

customer_reviews.title: Microsoft Natural Ergonomic Keyboard 4000 for Business - Wired
customer_reviews.text: I love this style of keyboard, having been using this model since its release, a LONG time ago. But this was a knock off, letters started wearing off with a few months, right after the return window of course. Even though I only look at the keyboard when I need to type a pwd for the 2nd time it is really bad the letters did not even last a year. My original was mint for over 10 years, this type well etc, still using a year later but for price I expected much more quality. I do NOT recommend.
customer_reviews.author: G.M.

customer_reviews.title: Good ergonomic keyboard
customer_reviews.text: At first I wasn't sure about the attachment at the front of the wrist rest (which is detachable) so I have used it with and without the attachment and I can see why they offer this extra feature. It offers a better positioning for your wrists. Very happy with the ergonomics of this keyboard. Some of the keys are stiff and not as 'soft touch' as I'd like so that's the only reason I didn't give it 5 stars. However some of the keys are starting to soften as I use it; hoping the whole keyboard will loosen up. Would definitely recommend this keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: pdseskkr

customer_reviews.title: Key Markers already wearing off!
customer_reviews.text: I have really liked the ergonomics of this keyboard - It really lets the hands relax and keeps them in a natural position - That is a solid 5 - BUT !!!!!! - I expect the manufacturer to find a way to make the letters on the keys to not rub off after less than 2 months of use! I use my keyboard a lot - but this should not be an issue. PERIOD! It is new enough that there are no physical malfunctions other than the key markers - I don't use the volume control so did not rate it.
customer_reviews.author: DrPrepper

customer_reviews.title: Love this keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this keyboard since they came out with the first version in 1994 and use it at home and at work. If you like tiny keyboards or have tiny hands, then like my wife, it will take some time to get used to it. If you have large hands like me, then you'll love it. The slope of the keyboard and the angle of the keys will ease carpal tunnel issues. The programmable hot keys are great for adjusting the volume and opening programs quickly. I just wish they made a cordless version.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: letters disappeared after six months
customer_reviews.text: I like the ergonomic fit and function, however the letters on the keys started to disappear after about 6 months of moderate use. They show up better in this picture because of the flash but in reality, they are very hard to see. I work part time from home and don't use any special hand creams or anything that would have dissolved these letters from the keyboard. It's very frustrating and I'm trying to figure out a creative way to paint the letters on or get stickers, etc. For this price, I shouldn't be trying to fix anything on my keyboard less than a year after purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard that's comfortable and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is easy to use and comfortable. They hold up well. I had my last one for 5 years. I have one for my home office and my work office. At work, when I am conducting individual training I'll have someone sit at my desk while I work with them on a computer skill. Most have never used an ergonomic keyboard before and are used to a laptop keyboard. Time and again people are impressed with how easy this keyboard is to work with and some have requested them for their own office to plug into their laptop. The height has one adjustment available to allow the user the best position for their comfort.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie D

customer_reviews.title: Best Keyboard I've found for Work/Home
customer_reviews.text: I was given one of these keyboards at work when I started. It took me a while to adjust to it but once I did, I found that I cannot use a conventional keyboard now. My wrists used to get sore using a standard keyboard, this solved that problem. I bought a second one that is identical to the one at work (haven't changed over the years) and it was the best thing I've done for comfort on my home PC ever. The only negative is it's size; however, the many features (some of which I never use) negate the size issues. Comfort level is amazing and the keys are very responsive. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: P. StOnE

customer_reviews.title: Fancy Keyboard, No User Guide
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard was apparently intended for use in corporate cubicle farms. It comes in a plain brown box with no user guide. On my second or third work session, the keyboard ignored all keystrokes, despite the green number lock light being lit, indicating connection to the mothership. This has not happened again. It’s a wonderful keyboard, very comfortable to use. Unfortunately, the F-keys ignore keystrokes. Today, I discovered that to the right of [F12] is [F Lock]. Pressing this key turns on the green F light, and enables the use of F-keys. Hurray!
customer_reviews.author: Richard Reese (author of Understanding Sustainability)

customer_reviews.title: Not exactly durable
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable, Lights that tell you what's on and off, and convenient buttons are all wonderful, but they don't make up for the fact the keyboard will last you about 2 or 3 months if you have to move it around at all. This is a fine keyboard if you keep it at a desk, and again, never move it. Move it around at all, though (which I do), and the wires break very quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Art Scott

customer_reviews.title: fine until spontaneously broken, just over a year after purchase
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this keyboard in Sept 2016 to use for work. It's been getting workday use since then. In November 2017, the W key stopped working when pushed and then randomly Ws started showing up when typing even when W was not typed. I cleaned it with the electronics duster spray and took the key off to clean underneath with no luck. This keyboard has been well-maintained but borked after just over a year. I was otherwise happy with it, but ultimately would not recommend unless you want to replace it every year or so (which I loathe, seems so wasteful).
customer_reviews.author: Reads&Runs

customer_reviews.title: It was awesome, for awhile
customer_reviews.text: The one I use at work has lasted 3+ years now, and the split keyboard design is so much better than a regular keyboard that I hate having to type on my laptop. But the one I bought on Amazon only lasted about 1 1/2 years; the 'O' key stopped working, and just one defective key can render a keyboard useless. If it had lasted as long as my work one has lasted, my rating would be 5+ stars. But I will be ordering another one for home use, because the similar, but less expensive replacement, is vastly inferior to the Microsoft model.
customer_reviews.author: Gunners86

customer_reviews.title: This is a comfortable keyboard buy to big and bulkey overall
customer_reviews.text: Just the plain facts: This keyboard is nice in the fact it fits the hands well and has many options for being ergo however it is overly large. Unless you only want a keyboard on your desk it's going to take up all the room you have. The nice part is the soft hand rests and shape. It's much too large to fit under smaller monitor stands and is too deep due to the design to push out of the way. This keyboard is would be fine for a desk devoted to it and it only. If you have the average smaller desk you wont be able to fit it anyplace really. It's that huge.
customer_reviews.author: Chris X

customer_reviews.title: Fixed a bad typing habit.
customer_reviews.text: I had a bad habit of using my right hand for the letter "t". This fixed it. Useful for anyone who wants to improve their form and keeps the hands separated more toward shoulder width, which is good for your posture. Cheap too. Good for gaming as well since its programmable. Its no merc stealth, the greatest gaming keyboard of all time (, but nothing is.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: I love it. I can see why people with small ...
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant to buy this keyboard, due to complaints about the noisy space bar. But they must have fixed that problem, because I don't notice it at all. When I first started using it, I thought, Yikes, how am I going to get used to this thing? It is different than a straight, level keyboard. But after a couple weeks, I love it. I can see why people with small hands were complaining, because at first it seems like you have to search and move around a lot. But it's a short learning curve, and now I love it. Very comfortable and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: jarpc

customer_reviews.title: They're generally pretty durable. The first sign of age is that ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm on my third MS Ergo Keyboard 4000. I'm a wide-shouldered guy, and getting my wrists bent to work on a regular keyboard gives me tendonitis. This keyboard has reduced the incidence considerably. They're generally pretty durable. The first sign of age is that faux leather palm rests delaminate, and then the identifying marks on the keyboard wear off. Ultimately, junk gets into the keyboard and makes it stop working. They seem last about 5 years, which is pretty darn good. I like that the price keeps coming down, as well - my first one was $115, the second one $70, and this one was $45. Maybe I should order an extra just in case they stop making them.
customer_reviews.author: Zina Deretsky

customer_reviews.title: Keys stick
customer_reviews.text: Okay, so I bought this keyboard because my previous ones space bar would get stuck and then quit working. (same model) So I bought a new one because I love this keyboard so much. I can type fast and for a long time without my hands hurting. But when I got this in the mail I was annoyed to see that when I pulled it out of it's sleeve ther were finger prints already on several of the keys andthe keys felt broken in already. I could deal with that, so I wiped it off and go to it. But now instead of the spacebar not working the N key gets stuck down. I will be asking for a repacement.
customer_reviews.author: Kwells

customer_reviews.title: QUALITY ISSUES
customer_reviews.text: I DID NOT MEAN TO WRITE THIS REVIEW IN ALL CAPS. HOWEVER, THE CAPS LOCK IS STUCK. I DO NOT MEAN THE KEY, BUT THE FUNCTION. IT WILL NOT TURN OFF REGARDLESS OF WHAT I DO. I CAN TURN IT UNPLUG AND IT WONT CHANGE. THIS ACTUALLY STARTED THIS WEEK WHEN THE STICKER FOR THE LETTER "A" WORE OFF. ALL OTHER KEYS ARE FINE. TODAY, THE NUMBER LOCK BEGAN ACTING UP ON THE KEYPAD. THE NUMBER LOCK SHUTS OFF WHEN YOU CLICK THE "/" RIGHT NEXT TO IT. IT WILL NOT TURN IT BACK ON THOUGH. NOW THE CAPS LOCK IS SIMPLY STUCK ON. MY RETURN WINDOW ENDED JUNE 3RD.
customer_reviews.author: Ex

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable keyboard.  Sadly it just doesn't last.  I went through 2 of them in under 6 months.
customer_reviews.text: I am really disappointed in this keyboard. The layout is great. The comfort and button press firmness is almost perfect. So why the disappointment, and 1 star review? It isn't built well. This order was to replace my first keyboard which I had purchased locally and only lasted about 3 months (Space and Ctrl buttons failed). Sadly this one lasted just over 2 months before it failed (several letters stopped responding). It's a shame because of how comfortable it was to type on. Come on Microsoft you can do better.
customer_reviews.author: J0hngalt

customer_reviews.title: This keyboard is quiet and solidly built
customer_reviews.text: Excellent service, timely service, product arrived as advertised in mint condition, easy to install or even easier as a replacement for an old worn out keyboard of the same type. I have large hands and I have used this split keyboard for years without injury to my hands or wrists---no carpel tunnel incidents and I am almost 70 years of age. Once you get used to one of these keyboards you will never want to go back
customer_reviews.author: Alchemist

customer_reviews.title: Good ergonomic keyboard
customer_reviews.text: No matter how many MSFT keyboard (this particular model) I purchase, the space bar key always seems to be a problem. I purchased over 4 of these over 3 years for various locations - home, work, etc. and I always find the right side of the space bar a bit clunky for smooth typing. The keyboard is ergonomic, easy on hands but it is loud.
customer_reviews.author: JH

customer_reviews.title: Will buy again and it works with Mac OSX
customer_reviews.text: This is the 3rd Microsoft Natural Ergonomic Keyboard I have bought since it came out. I am pretty abusive with keyboards and these keyboard holdup nicely and great for typing 12+ straight hours while working on long projects. I initial use these keyboard with MS Windows laptops and desktops and four years ago I started using it with my late 2012 Mac Mini that was upgrade to 16gb of ram and 1 TB SSD. I downloaded the drive for OS X and customize it for my needs. Hopefully in three to four years when I need another one, MS will still make it.
customer_reviews.author: Edward A. Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Wish I'da got one 10 years ago.
customer_reviews.text: I had carpal tunnel surgery on both hands a few years ago. I can feel all my fingers again but my wrists and hand hurt like the devil most of the time. Working on my regular keyboard was pure torture and I had to stop after 20 minutes to rest. This keyboard is soooo much better. A bit weird at first. I'm still getting used to it. HuGE difference in the pain level in my wrists and hands. Wish I'da got one 10 years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Thunderbolt

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these keyboards six or seven years ago and it's been (for the price) an excellent keyboard. So I'm building a new computer and thought I'd buy another. This one is very different (and almost $20 less expensive). Almost no pressure required to press keys and no feedback, so I'm always getting mmmultippple kkkkeyppppresses. After return shipping and the inevitable restocking fee, probably not worth it to return. OTOH, it gave me the incentive to buy a good mechanical keyboard, which is amazingly good.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Pleased with purchase
customer_reviews.text: I got used to this right away should have bought this ages ago love the shape of it and takes all the pressure off my wrists other we came with no instructions so I am still trying to figure out some of the keys but I suppose I could just Google that LOL I took off one star because the keys are a little sticky and squeaky but the shape is fantastic very happy with my purchase will be getting a second one for our vacation home soon
customer_reviews.author: The Empress

customer_reviews.title: Great General Purpose Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Okay, so I really do love this keyboard, but I have one really big complaint that won't impact most people. I type at over 100 words per minute, and this keyboard doesn't always register all of my keystrokes - if I slow down a little, it has no struggle picking up all of them, but it's just a little inconvenient for me. I love everything else about this keyboard, though! Great for having in my office, but not so great for social/gaming.
customer_reviews.author: Fracknoid

customer_reviews.title: Best keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I have gone through half a dozen of these between work and home, they are adjustable to comfort and have never found another keyboard that comes close to this one. After using these the past decade, each time i need a new one, I get more worried they will eventually be discontinued, thankfully they have not. If they ever do, I will probably buy a dozen or more to make sure I have them for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Pyro

customer_reviews.title: Letters wore off in two months!
customer_reviews.text: I have had other Microsoft Ergonomic keyboards and prefer them. My only complaint with this one is that the letters wore off in the first couple of months! F is completely gone after four months use, S is almost gone and E is showing wear. This is a home computer, used for a couple of hours daily. I am a touch typist, but not everyone who uses this keyboard is. I am very disappointed. EDIT: My other Microsoft keyboards have served me for five or six years. This one is has developed has developed unresponsive keys in just 14 months.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: It's my third one. My second one was still working , just the letters and numbers were faded away. So I thought going with a different one . (germany made) , But the german made is nothing compare to this one. Had to send they other one back because it was not working right and ended up to buy me the Microsoft keyboard again . Love how easy the keys work and the layout .
customer_reviews.author: D. Hall

customer_reviews.title: Product works great as expected!
customer_reviews.text: I have several of these keyboards and the feel and function of them are all as expected. The only thing I was extremely dissatisfied with is the manner in which it was shipped. A shipping label on top of the product box. The product box was not even taped shut so that the product was fully accessible to all mail handlers! Extremely poor handling particularly in these COVID-19 times!
customer_reviews.author: Ds

customer_reviews.title: great upgrade from Original Natural keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I have graduated from the Original Microsoft Natural Keyboard, which finally gave up on me. Actually the ENTER key gave up on me. Given it was from 1996 and travelled with me everywhere I was employed at. This new one took a few days to get the hang of, I don't use any of the other short cut buttons, I don't use them, and never will. But they're there and they are NOT in the way. I like the texture of the keys, the layout is perfect and the keys are easy to read. Go Microsoft!
customer_reviews.author: EricF

customer_reviews.title: Third one, and still happy
customer_reviews.text: I put my keyboards through the wringer, and so it is normal for key markings to wear out and other things to go haywire over time. I lost one of these keyboards to a full glass of water and glass. hah So, aside from my antics with keyboards that should destroy them...these have been great for my carpal tunnel and the best gaming keyboards that I've ever had. I will continue to get them as long as they are available.
customer_reviews.author: Patty

customer_reviews.title: to large
customer_reviews.text: I am returning. Keyboard is too large, so you have to lift your hands to far to go to the keypad and/or to your mouse, making it so you wear your wrists , also creating too many typo's. I really tried to get used to it but by the end of the day my forearms are much more tired that a regular keyboard with small mouse. About the loud spacebar, it's isn't that loud as others made it out to be. Over all construction is good. Lots of adjustments to it so that it can be customized a bit. It's just too much moving around on it for me to be comfortable .
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My favorite ergonomic keyboard that I can find
customer_reviews.text: It's hard to find ergonomic keyboards like this one. I find I type a lot faster on this style. It is a bit thick for some keyboard trays but does well on a "floating" style one that you find in many offices. I also appreciate that they're wired, as I don't like scrambling for a battery in the middle of working on something. I did like the previous style a bit more, and it's lost connection once at work (I just unplugged it an plugged it back in to get it working again).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Will Not Work With Latest Mac OS Systems
customer_reviews.text: First, I love this keyboard and have used one for over 10 years. Guess I've been lucky that they continued to work well past Apple's OS 10.10. In fact, it worked up through 10.13 (High Sierra). But, alas, although it worked for a while with 10.14 (Mojave) - even up to 10.14.5, it is now toast with 10.14.6. Even switching the option and alt key to make the alt key the Mac Command key doesn't work. Very sad...
customer_reviews.author: Bob Champion

customer_reviews.title: Product works but had to spend a lot of time looking for info about it
customer_reviews.text: Product seems functional at this point, only had it for a week. It was shipped in a cardboard box loosely set inside another cardboard box, not much protection, but it wasn't damaged either. There was no user manual or useful guide with it and it is sophisticated piece of equipment with more bells and whistles than I'll ever need. I would have like a user's manual with it or a CD, it would have been very helpful. I would have liked for it to be protected better for shipping. I've had some packages come battered badly, some with portions of the content missing. I won't accept anything shipped FedEx until they stop supporting NRA.
customer_reviews.author: Elli P. Hunt

customer_reviews.title: This is my favorite keyboard. Very comfortable to use
customer_reviews.text: This is my favorite keyboard. Very comfortable to use. But, I probably would not buy another. I have owned three or four of these keyboards, and in all cases, certain letters have tended to rub off the tops of the keys. This happens after only a few months of use. I'm a pretty good touch typist, so it's not a huge problem, but I find it very annoying that Microsoft has not issued a revised version to take care of the problem that so many people have complained about. Otherwise, it's a great keyboard. Fix this, Microsoft, and I'll be a loyal 4000 series keyboard customer forever.
customer_reviews.author: DD

customer_reviews.title: Great now that I am used to it.
customer_reviews.text: This was my first try at a separated keyboard and it took a little practice to be comfortable, but now I love it. Good quality, good key feel. I love the control options and the easy to see lights to let you know what keys are in use. Very happy with my purchase. I use it at work instead of the cheap keyboard that came with the tower. I don't know about gaming.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Much Easier on the Wrists, But You Have To Give it Time to Get Used To It.
customer_reviews.text: I've worked off a split keyboard for 15 years or so. I have a hard time now typing on a regular keyboard. This style keyboard, once you get used to it (give it a couple of weeks) is a joy to type on and so much easier on your wrists. This particular one is loaded with buttons and features to help control your computer. I love it, but you need to get used to it.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Not like they used to be.
customer_reviews.text: I had an old PS/2 MS Ergo years ago. This thing looks similar, but just isn't built the same. The keys are gummier than the older styles, and the function-lock makes using the F keys a chore. This is the first keyboard in over a decade that I've managed to accidentally destroy, and I did so in less than two weeks of ownership. I spilled about 6oz of water on the keyboard. After removing the keycaps and letting it dry for another two weeks, many keys are still unresponsive. Two stars because it was comfortable while it lasted.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff B

customer_reviews.title: Really saves wear and tear on your body!
customer_reviews.text: I love, love, love the design of this keyboard and I'm so glad Microsoft hasn't monkeyed with it over the years. It's kept my extensor tendinitis and my wrists problems from flaring up since I started using it. (Whatever you do, don't type a lot on your laptop keyboard -- that's a recipe for problems!!!) The reason I'm not giving this 5 stars is that the letters wear off pretty quickly -- I've already pretty much obliterated the E and S and I've had the new keyboard for about a month. Gonna have to put some clear nail polish on the rest of the keys.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Keypad stopped working after 2 months
customer_reviews.text: A line of numbers stopped working on the numeric keypad (., 3. 6. 9. *) which is not conducive to the accounting work I perform. I contacted Amazon who connected me with Microsoft since I was past the 30 days yet the product was still under manufacturer warranty. After more than an HOUR on the phone with several different people, giving them remote access to my computer to trouble shoot even, I was finally told they would send out a replacement keyboard. The call was totally sketchy. Here I am a month later and NOTHING. They never sent my replacement, they never sent me a label to return the broken keyboard, just a complete waste of my time. VERY disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Fergs

customer_reviews.title: One of the only true ergonomic KB's out there
customer_reviews.text: Years of using Mouse Systems KB's, but they left the market at PS/2 and now getting hard to find. Gambled on this, just as good ergonomics: split KB, angled left and right, KB support in the front instead of the back. Instructions? What instructions? Obviously a lot of features, but not a clue what they are and how to use them. MS, really? That's why I gave it four stars instead of five.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: I absolutely love it
customer_reviews.text: I was once the owner of the first microsoft natural keyboard (white keyboard from many many years ago) and was eager to try this new iteration. I have to say, it is a true improvement in every sense. My first keyboard lasted for well over a decade (and was lost while moving, who knows maybe it would work if I still had it). This looks just as well made, but ... Only time but, judging from reviews and my experience with the other plus the its build ... this looks like it will be in perfect shape for many many years
customer_reviews.author: EdelCorralLira

customer_reviews.title: Good ergonomic keyboard- while it works!
customer_reviews.text: I liked this keyboard at first. Very fast shipping, the keyboard has sort of a raised base on the front, which really helps with my wrist issues. The material they use for the arm rest is very good as well. I like the feel. It is very bulky which is a bit of a detractor. Also, now, a few weeks in, the space bar has started sticking and the whole thing is mostly unusable unless it’s in a very specific position on the desk. I called and amazon told me they don’t have replacements. Still trying to decide what to do since I can’t afford the upgraded one. But it was good while it worked.
customer_reviews.author: NR

customer_reviews.title: Is an amazing keyboard for professionals
customer_reviews.text: Is an amazing keyboard for professionals. A very solid options for people that uses both hands to type. But as many products in life it has is drawbacks, specifically on Mac's, and in my opinion it has two. The first drawback is that is not clear that it works better if you download the Microsoft driver to use in a Mac. Second drawback regarding this issue is that you still need to map manually the 'F-(1-12)' keys to make it work correctly. Another features that this keyboard lacks of is the inclusion of at least an extra usb port, which most other brands support already. Otherwise this keyboard is great and I do recommend it
customer_reviews.author: Aldo Infanzon

customer_reviews.title: Good ergonomics, very poor quality
customer_reviews.text: I owned few keyboards Microsoft Natural Ergonomic Keyboard 4000 over the past years. The good part: It's a very good ergonomic keyboard to prevent injures for wrists. The bad part: 1. Letters are wearing off quickly, sometimes just in few weeks. 2. Some keys stop working after some months of heavy usage, e.g. space bar. PS: did not try to use the warranty, probably Microsoft may replace it
customer_reviews.author: ian

customer_reviews.title: 😞 Dissapointed
customer_reviews.text: One of the keyboard letter keys , letter X stopped working at about five weeks after using the board. I thought it would be easy to fix or at least to use by taking the cover off and putting a probe of some kind in it, but no. The letter X was unusable. I thought , " I won't use X very often, but I use it enough so much so that the entire board had to go into the trash can. Very dissapointed. Too late to return.
customer_reviews.author: WillChill

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic if you're truly looking for an ergonomic keyboard
customer_reviews.text: The cord is pretty long which is good if you have your computer propped up and far from the keyboard but you will use two USB ports if you have a wireless mouse too. The keyboard itself is REALLy good. The height is perfect to relieve the stress from your wrists and your hands settle in a fantastic position to alleviate any issues you have from chronic pain while typing.
customer_reviews.author: Marney Reid

customer_reviews.title: Love my Ergo Keyboard. Had to replace with new one after 10 years
customer_reviews.text: loved my previous one, but I used it so long the keys were worn down and my kids couldn't use it to type (since they don't teach typing/keyboarding any more. The newer model is quieter than my previous and love the design. I much prefer to type on this than normal keyboard. I have ordered and used these at work as well. Love this keyboard!
customer_reviews.author: Erik Okerholm

customer_reviews.title: Love it, I'm not interested in any other layout.
customer_reviews.text: I have used Ergonomic keyboards now for several years now and when my old 4000 developed a defective key I replaced it with a like item. I have only had the new one a couple of months now. They will last 2 to 3 maybe 4 years and will need to be replaced. Other than that, I love it, I hope they never change the layout, They say it takes a little while to get use to it but I don't ever remember my getting use to it. It just seemed natural from the beginning and I have a terrible time using a normal keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: George Albright

customer_reviews.title: It's large
customer_reviews.text: It does help with your hand placement. I would like it better if it was a bit smaller. Keys are large and spaced further apart than a regular keyboard. It's probably great with those with large hands. After using it everyday (7 hours/day), I am still not as fast as I was with my flat keyboard but I am trying to get used to it. I still miss hitting some of the keys but it's getting better. Just a big learning curve.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce T

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: My first one had an issue with a irritating squeak with the space bar, but with a quick chat I had another the next day. I shipped the defective one back and have been happy every since. It took me a minute to get the hang of typing on it, but I'll admit that now I actually type faster and more accurately. I"m an admitted eye typer. With this one I can type easily by touch.
customer_reviews.author: Richard M

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware - You may get retail instead of business version.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the business version specifically because the lettering is in the top left corner of the keys, not in the center (due to the many complaints of the lettering in the center wearing off faster). What arrived to my office was the retail version with the lettering in the center of the keys. Unfortunately, I can't return it because I need to use the computer I bought it for and my previous keyboard died... but I just wanted to give people a heads up that you may not get the correct version in your order. Other than that, it's a perfectly good keyboard if you need a split ergonomic keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: J. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Spongy wobbly keys - feels bad
customer_reviews.text: The keys on this keyboard feel... shaky at best. Lots of wiggle. Very poor tactile engagement. Long wobbly throw on activation, spongy delayed depress. I like the layout. but overall, the keyboard feels too big and clunky. The wireless natural feels much better, despite chic-let keys. There are no real good options in this price range for a good ergo-split keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Victor Mancini

customer_reviews.title: Makes my wrist pain go away
customer_reviews.text: Excellent keyboard! I prefer to use without the extra stand underneath. Made my wrist pain go away :) My old one at work broke due to work conditions requiring keyboard be removed each day and locker door damaging cord. Didn't have to think twice about buying a new one. This one I paid $33.33, and Best Buy is selling this for $15 right now, so I guess pricing could be better.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: The Keyboard for programmers or heavy computer users.
customer_reviews.text: I have been using these keyboards for years, the only keyboard I ever plan to buy for as long as it's available. They do wear out and can get dirty, as would any keyboard. Just in case, I've bought several spares as I'm so accustomed to the keyboard I can barely work on regular one now. The key thing about this keyboard is that when you use it your arms don't have to be perpendicular. The posture keeps your wrist straight, greatly reducing strain. If you work on your keyboard for hours on end, like a typical programmer or heavy computer users, you should get this keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: David Fowler

customer_reviews.title: Love this keyboard!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second one, i use a computer all day and wore out the old one. If you are not used to this style it can take some getting used to but once you get the hang of it you won't want to go back to the old style. I saw a review that said theirs was noisy and made clicking sounds but both of mine have been whisper quiet. I highly recommend this keyboard if your a heavy computer user.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Halligan

customer_reviews.title: Great Keyboard Buy Over Newer Models
customer_reviews.text: This is my third time I’ve had this keyboard because I love it. It’s definitely Microsoft’s best keyboard. And for the price you can’t beat it. I brought the beer version of this keyboard and I went back to this one. It’s comfortable and has way more options than the beer models for half the price. The only negatives are it’s pretty large and the keys require a little effort to push and are a little noisy but it’s not a deal breaker. I work home and it’s a great keyboard to have.
customer_reviews.author: mmoore4249

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy on Amazon
customer_reviews.text: I bought this back in June to set up my home office. Use the exact same keyboard at work and love it. Unfortunately, I'm just now getting around to setting up my office and this pile of keyboard doesn't work. I've tried installing drivers from the Microsoft site to no avail. Ive never been more frustrated! Sadly I can't return it as my window has passed. I would not recommend purchasing this keyboard on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffytoodle

customer_reviews.title: Love this keyboard more than any other.
customer_reviews.text: I have bought so many of these keyboards for home and work I must be up to about 20 now. They are really large, so if you're space constrained it might be tough, but frankly they are so great you should just find more space. I transitioned my 8-year old son over to this full size keyboard this year, previously I had him on a 2/3 size kids keyboard. For anyone learning to touch type this keyboard is awesome as it will at least force you to use the correct hand for each half of the keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Roland Wooster

customer_reviews.title: Ergonomic and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for work as their keyboards were to small. This keyboard is great for those who have typed a long time and often. It gives full wrist support. I think everyone should learn to use this type of keyboard to insure the less likilehood of carpal tunnel or ganglion cysts that can come about from not holding hands correctly when typing.
customer_reviews.author: M Martin

customer_reviews.title: Kinda Expensive But a Good Keyboard for Broader People
customer_reviews.text: I use this every day. I'm typing on it now. It works pretty well with the exception of when inputting numbers and symbols from the number pad on the right it lags, which can be annoying. Also, be prepared for the keys to lose the indicator, as they'll wear off pretty quickly with daily use. Otherwise, this is the most comfortable option I could find being a 'broad' shouldered person that finds typing on a standard keyboard to be almost a chore. Ergonomics here are very good for me.
customer_reviews.author: POOOORKCHOOOOP

customer_reviews.title: A great comfortable keyboard but arrived a little defective :(
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard has been out and around for a long time. It is a solid, comfortable keyboard for office use. Today I received my order and found one very unusual issue: The "N" key is warped such that it presses down the space bar whenever I press 'N'! If I press the N key anywhere in the middle or middle right the space bar goes with it. I think I can fix it by pulling out the N key and shaving it down but that isn't something most people will like to have to do with their new keyboard!
customer_reviews.author: Andy P

customer_reviews.title: Formerly Best Keyboard Ever
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY IF RUNNING WINDOWS 10. One of the latest updates is not fully compatible with this keyboard and it will start to randomly generate a sticking key when you are just finished typing something and pause. Microsoft tech support knows the issue exists but has NO viable solution after spending significant time on my computer randomly checking various settings, uninstall/reinstall keyboard & driver, etc...
customer_reviews.author: pdavis830

customer_reviews.title: The keyboard that was great, killed by cost cutting
customer_reviews.text: I have an older one of these at work and it is great. The only mainstream ergo keyboard with full keys (not laptop keys). I bought one for home and the build quality is much worse, but worst of all is the key feel is now terrible and the spacebar sticks down sometimes. It feels like they built the "same" keyboard in a different factory and tried to make it cheaper. In doing so they killed the last of the good mainstream ergo keyboards. I'm going back to a second hand "Microsoft Natural Keyboard Pro". Sad that this is actually much worse that its predecessor.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Grealish

customer_reviews.title: Used for over 10 years
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this keyboard. I have been a medical transcriptionist for over 10 years and have used this keyboard almost from day one. I have never had wrist pain or issues. I just replaced the first one I bought several years ago. The only reason I replaced it was the letters had worn off the keys and the spacebar started to stick, probably from years of multiple spills. It takes a little getting used to at first because of the design but definitely the best keyboard I have ever used.
customer_reviews.author: Mary A Dunbar

product_meta.title: Microsoft Natural Ergonomic Keyboard 4000 for Business - Wired
product_meta.description:
Color:BlackType in total comfort with the split ergonomic design of the Natural Ergonomic Keyboard 4000, which encourages natural hand, wrist and forearm positioning.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER


MICROSOFT NATURAL ERGONOMIC KEYBOARD 4000 FOR BUSINESS
Advanced ergonomic design MAKE THE MOVE TO SUPERIOR COMFORT WITH THIS BREAKTHROUGH KEYBOARD DESIGN
Place your hands and arms naturally and comfortably with the Microsoft Natural Ergonomic Keyboard 4000. The improved split design encourages a more natural hand, wrist, and forearm position and its new curved key layout makes keys easier to reach. The Zoom Slider lets you zoom in for close-ups of Web pages, images, and more — with just the touch of a finger. And 5 customizable “My Favorites” keys give you instant access to the folders, files, and Web pages you use most.

KEY FEATURES
 1. Zoom - Get a closer look quickly and accurately with the intuitive Zoom Slider.
    
    
 2. Customizable Hot Keys - Perform common tasks, like opening documents and replying to email messages, with the touch of a button.
    
    
 3. Improved Number Pad - Quickly reach for commonly used symbols, such as equal sign, parentheses, and "Backspace." They are now located just above the number pad.
    
    
 4. Ergonomic Design - Type in total comfort-ergonomic design encourages natural wrist and arm alignment so you can work without discomfort.
    
    


PRODUCT DETAILS
 * Device Stage - Quickly and easily access common tasks, including product information, registration, settings, and more for popular devices such as cell phones, cameras, printers, and mouse, keyboard, and webcam products.
 * Taskbar Favorites - Easily access programs in the taskbar with convenient keyboard hot keys. The keys automatically adapt to the new location of applications that have been rearranged by dragging.
 * Email and Internet Hot Keys - Touch a button to quickly access your email application and the Internet.
 * Multimedia Keys - Quickly and easily access and control all of your media from your keyboard.
 * Lockable F Key - Lock your F keys to avoid engaging them unintentionally.
 * Integrated Palm Rest - Get better support with this plush, integrated palm rest.
 * Cutting-Edge Design - Whether you're at work or play, improve your performance with cutting-edge Microsoft design.


SYSTEM REQUIREMENTS
 * Computer/Operating System
   Windows 8, Windows 7, Windows Vista, Windows XP (excluding Windows XP 64-bit)
 * Hard Drive
   100 MB
 * Other
   USB Port
